title: 113_hr697
content: The Act titled "Three Kids Mine Remediation and Reclamation Act" defines terms like Federal land, hazardous substance, pollutant, contaminant, remedy, and Henderson Redevelopment Agency. The Act also references a specific map for the Three Kids Mine Project Area. The "Three Kids Mine Remediation and Reclamation Act" defines terms like map, Responsible Party, Secretary, State, and Three Kids Mine Project Site. It also includes provisions for the land conveyance process. The Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 requires the Secretary to convey Federal land to the Henderson Redevelopment Agency within 90 days of meeting specified conditions. The Agency must pay fair market value for the land as determined by an appraisal conducted according to national standards. The Secretary must prepare a reasonable estimate of costs for assessing, remediating, and reclaiming the Three Kids Mine Project Site, following national appraisal standards and not considering historical mining contamination on the Federal land. The Phase II environmental site assessment for the Three Kids Mine Project Site must be based on a comprehensive report approved by the State and prepared according to ASTM International Standard E-2137-06. The Phase II environmental site assessment for the Three Kids Mine Project Site must follow ASTM International Standard E-2137-06. Additionally, it should adhere to ASTM International Standard E-1527-05 for Phase I assessments and E-1903-11 for Phase II assessments. The Secretary will review cost information provided by the Henderson Redevelopment Agency, the Responsible Party, and the State for estimating costs. If there is a disagreement, they will jointly select experts to assist in making the final cost estimate. The Secretary will begin the appraisal and cost estimates within 30 days of the Act's enactment. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency or Responsible Party will reimburse appraisal costs. The fair market value of Federal land will be adjusted based on estimated remediation and reclamation costs. The conveyance of land is contingent on the execution of a mine remediation and reclamation agreement. The mine remediation and reclamation agreement required under subparagraph (A) shall be an enforceable consent order or agreement between the State and the Responsible Party to perform necessary remediation work at the Three Kids Mine Project Site to protect human health and the environment. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency and the State will ensure compliance with environmental regulations for hazardous substances. The Agency must notify the Secretary within 90 days of readiness to accept conveyance of Federal land. The Federal land is withdrawn from public land laws for a 10-year period. The Federal land is withdrawn from various forms of entry, appropriation, and disposal under public land laws, as well as mining and mineral leasing laws. Any withdrawal under public land laws that includes Federal land no longer needed by the Bureau of Reclamation is relinquished to allow for immediate conveyance. Existing rights holders have exclusive and perpetual use for water operations, maintenance, and improvement. The River Mountains Area of Critical Environmental Concern boundary is adjusted to exclude the Three Kids Mine Project Site. Responsibilities for mine remediation and reclamation agreement fall on the Responsible Party and the State of Nevada after conveyance. The conveyance under this Act must meet the terms of the agreement executed under section 3(b)(2). If not met, the Secretary retains responsibility for additional response actions to protect public health and the environment. The Act does not affect compliance with environmental laws or the authority of the United States to enforce them. The Southern Nevada Public Land Management Act of 1998 does not apply to land conveyed under this Act.
